title.narrative: Fostering Inclusive Development And Good Governance In Northern Kosovo

description.narrative:
The project represents a unique collaboration between UN-Habitat, one of the best-established UN agencies in Kosovo, and PAX, an international NGO with a long-standing presence in Northern Kosovo. It responds to the urgent needs in Northern Kosovo with a strategic, comprehensive package of support to build municipal planning and management capacities, strengthen the social contract and social cohesion, and enhance coordination within a framework of inter-municipal cooperation and multi-level governance.
The long-term headline goal of the project is to foster inclusive development and good governance in Northern Kosovo through planned and conflict-sensitive development of municipalities, with communities integrated at all stages of planning and implementation, and within a framework of effective inter-municipal cooperation and multi-level governance.While the Intermediary goal for inception phase is to conduct baseline assessment and establish institutional, operational, and political framework for successful implementation of a three-year programme.
The objectives of the inception phase are as follows:- Assess municipal and civil society capacities with a view to calibrate the scope of work/ support to be provided in the core implementation phase of the programme and devise/ refine related baseline, targets and indicators - Kick-start building capacities of municipal administrations and relevant stakeholders in North Kosovo with a view to pave the way for the development of strategic planning processes and products- Invest in strategic support to civil society mobilization and public dialogue contributing to increased local government transparency, responsiveness and accountability - Initiate processes leading to constructive inter-municipal and local-central dialogue and cooperationMain direct beneficiaries of the project will include:Local governments. The project will provide valuable guidance to local governments in North Kosovo, serving as a basis for policymakers to develop and refine policies and projects that advance inclusive development and robust governance. Local governments in North Kosovo will be equipped and empowered to deliver basic services, and strengthen the democratic engagement of citizens in decision-making, within an effective multi-level governance framework. Support will also be provided to local governments to engage in IMC and local-central cooperation activities, enabling them to develop practical joint projects and advocacy initiatives, to mutual advantage.Civil society. Local civil society organizations will benefit from opportunities to engage directly with municipal decision-makers, and contribute to community planning processes and the formulation of strategic public responses to key issues. Given the limited political space enjoyed by civil society organizations in North Kosovo, this will represent an important step toward raising the collective voice of civil society in the four municipalities.Government of Kosovo. Central line ministries, and especially MESP and MLGA, will benefit from a neutral institutional bridge to local governments in North Kosovo, enabling them to pursue deeper engagement and alignment. More generally, the Government of Kosovo will benefit from support in implementation of key aspects of the 2013 Brussels Agreement and subsequent follow-up deals; and be supported to develop future-oriented local government policies that leverage the advantages of subsidiarity and decentralization.Main indirect beneficiaries of the project will include:Population of North Kosovo. By contributing to the improved effectiveness of local government planning, management, and governance in the four northern municipalities, the project will be directly associated with improved prospects for inclusive development and long-term stability. The impact is likely to be especially significant for the most vulnerable constituencies, including women, young people, and displaced persons. The project will equip local populations with new tools and resources to assert voice and agency, to articulate needs and aspirations to duty-bearers, to demand responsiveness and accountability from local institutions, and to plan and implement actions in conjunction with state actors that improve living conditions and reduce drivers of conflict.

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: Institutional capacity of the municipalities sensitized and gradually increased, with municipal institutions set up to progressively implement strategic participatory planning processes and products in the interest of municipal development and territorial integration

description.narrative: Institutional capacity of the municipalities sensitized and gradually increased, with municipal institutions set up to progressively implement strategic participatory planning processes and products in the interest of municipal development and territorial integration

title.narrative:
No. (inc. % female and respective role), performance of local elected leaders and municipal staff engaged in planning processes
Municipal planning structures, mechanisms set-up for municipal and urban planning in seven municipalities
No. participatory tools, mechanisms implemented that support outreach, transparent, gender-sensitive and inclusive visioning/ planning processes
No. documented and analytical assessments/ tools developed vis-à-vis current urban, rural and environmental conditions in North Kosovo (4) and existing planning documents (3)

description.narrative:
No. (inc. % female and respective role), performance of local elected leaders and municipal staff engaged in planning processes
Municipal planning structures, mechanisms set-up for municipal and urban planning in seven municipalities
No. participatory tools, mechanisms implemented that support outreach, transparent, gender-sensitive and inclusive visioning/ planning processes
No. documented and analytical assessments/ tools developed vis-à-vis current urban, rural and environmental conditions in North Kosovo (4) and existing planning documents (3)

baseline.value:
No substantial on-the job assistance and capacity building and activities in the field of spatial and urban planning implemented.
Inheritance from a centralized planning system with minimal municipal planning, management and coordination capacities.
No tradition of practicing participatory approaches for decisions affecting regional and local development and constituencies.
Obsolete or no MDPs developed in partner municipalities
Partial data made available by the 2011 census (North)

target.value:
Annual increase performance of local elected leaders and municipal staff engaged in planning processes (against selected skills)
Annual increase of self-organisation required for conducting, implementing and monitoring spatial, urban planning processes
Annual increase no. participatory tools, mechanisms implemented that support outreach, transparent, gender-sensitive and inclusive visioning/ planning processes
MDPs assessment reports and road maps available (3)
Annual increase of available data, and translated into relevant maps and assessment reports (4)

title.narrative: Mechanisms for inter-municipal peer- learning and local-central dialogue tested towards mid and long term enhanced coordination, cooperation and pooling of resources for improved service delivery and living standards

description.narrative: Mechanisms for inter-municipal peer- learning and local-central dialogue tested towards mid and long term enhanced coordination, cooperation and pooling of resources for improved service delivery and living standards

title.narrative:
No. of relevant central, municipal staff (inc. % female) engaged in coordination, cooperation and dialogue activities for consistent planning and enhanced service delivery
No. municipalities in North and South Kosovo engaging in peer-learning and / or twining for good practice exchange and implementation vis-à-vis strategic planning and local development
Performance standing mechanism for local-central policy dialogue, development, coordination of planning functions

description.narrative:
No. of relevant central, municipal staff (inc. % female) engaged in coordination, cooperation and dialogue activities for consistent planning and enhanced service delivery
No. municipalities in North and South Kosovo engaging in peer-learning and / or twining for good practice exchange and implementation vis-à-vis strategic planning and local development
Performance standing mechanism for local-central policy dialogue, development, coordination of planning functions

baseline.value:
Poor municipal and inter-municipal coordination and cooperation capacities among and between northern municipalities and other municipalities
Minimal coordination and communication activities between structures of the northern municipalities and Kosovo Government

target.value:
Annual increase performance of relevant central, municipal staff (inc. % female) engaged in coordination, cooperation and dialogue activities for consistent planning and enhanced service delivery
Annual no. municipalities in North and South Kosovo engaging in peer-learning and / or twining for good practice exchange and implementation vis-à-vis strategic planning and local development
Annual increase performance of standing mechanism for local-central policy dialogue, development, coordination of planning functions

title.narrative: Quality of local governance stimulated through civil society mobilization and public dialogue towards increased local government transparency, responsiveness and accountability

description.narrative: Quality of local governance stimulated through civil society mobilization and public dialogue towards increased local government transparency, responsiveness and accountability

title.narrative:
No. municipalities with institutional capacities to involve civil society in decision-making processes
No. municipalities actively utilizing these capacities on a regular basis
No., performance of CSOs involved in public dialogue, decision-making process and monitoring
No., diversity of CSOs (incl. youth and women CSOs) able to effectively play role as co-decision-makers, co-producers vis-à-vis planning and public service delivery, monitoring municipal actions
No. joint initiatives targeting local governance processes involving citizens from Albanian, Serb communities
No. policy decisions by municipal authorities enacted, improved due to CSO and citizen contributions
Gender-based public perception of transparency, responsiveness, accountability, and performance of local government institutions

description.narrative:
No. municipalities with institutional capacities to involve civil society in decision-making processes
No. municipalities actively utilizing these capacities on a regular basis
No., performance of CSOs involved in public dialogue, decision-making process and monitoring
No., diversity of CSOs (incl. youth and women CSOs) able to effectively play role as co-decision-makers, co-producers vis-à-vis planning and public service delivery, monitoring municipal actions
No. joint initiatives targeting local governance processes involving citizens from Albanian, Serb communities
No. policy decisions by municipal authorities enacted, improved due to CSO and citizen contributions
Gender-based public perception of transparency, responsiveness, accountability, and performance of local government institutions

baseline.value:
Weak municipal capacities for public engagement
Low level of CSO involvement in public dialogue
Few and ad-hoc initiatives for linking constituencies and municipal leadership & administration
Limited cooperation among CSOs
Low CSO visibility and widespread reluctance to engage in public mobilization and action

target.value:
Annual increase no. municipalities with institutional capacities to involve civil society in decision-making processes
Annual increase no. municipalities actively utilizing these capacities
Annual increase no., performance of CSOs involved in public dialogue, decision-making process and monitoring
Annual no., diversity of CSOs (incl. youth and women CSOs) able to effectively play role as co-decision-makers, co-producers vis-à-vis planning and public service delivery, monitoring municipal actions
Annual increase no. policy decisions by municipal authorities enacted, improved due to CSO and citizen contributions

title.narrative: The monitoring measurement tools/ features for the three-year programme consensually devised and agreed in line with results generated from the systematic assessment of political/ technical municipal and civil society willingness/ capacities, as well as public opinion

description.narrative: The monitoring measurement tools/ features for the three-year programme consensually devised and agreed in line with results generated from the systematic assessment of political/ technical municipal and civil society willingness/ capacities, as well as public opinion

title.narrative:
The baseline assessment contains a set of clear and consensual baseline, targets and indicators for each three objectives of the three-year programme for efficient and progress measurement to be accomplished.
The baseline assessment and related monitoring instruments are endorsed by all parties.

description.narrative:
The baseline assessment contains a set of clear and consensual baseline, targets and indicators for each three objectives of the three-year programme for efficient and progress measurement to be accomplished.
The baseline assessment and related monitoring instruments are endorsed by all parties.

baseline.value: Some assumptions are made against main objectives and components of the tree-year programme based on previous activities with Northern stakeholders, situational knowledge, exchanges of experiences with professionals, selected reports (produced by third parties) and reality checks.

target.value: Initial baseline, targets and indicators are documented, assessed and completed as necessary to form a consistent programme monitoring system.
